Text saved: Asteroids are big rocks in space. Some asteroids can be dangerous to Earth. We call them 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' (PHAs). This is because they fly very close to us, less than 7.5 million kilometres away. NASA made a map of 1,400 PHAs. But none of them is a danger for the next 100 years. NASA has technology to watch these rocks. It can say if an asteroid is going to hit Earth. If an asteroid is a danger, there are two ways to protect our world.
